edu.brown.cs.gk16.bacon

Class BaconObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.brown.cs.gk16.bacon.BaconObject

  • public class BaconObject
extends Object
    This class is the representation of the autocorrect object. That means it stores all the corpus information in a trie and all the autocorrect settings and handles the autocorrect algorithms with the trie.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      BaconObject()
      Takes in no parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaconObject

    • Method Detail

      • addDb

        public int addDb(String file)
        Opens and reads a txt file containing words that form the data upon which the autocorrect object makes and ranks suggestions. Stores the words in the trie and the frequencies of unigrams/bigrams/ngrams in hashmaps.
        Parameters:
        file - the file containing text
        Returns:
        0 if no error occurs, -1 if an error occurs

      • connect

        public List<String> connect(String actor1,
                            String actor2)
        Executes the connect command by searching for the shortest path between the two actors specified by the strings actor1 and actor2 for which bacon to be handed off. If the actors aren't found in the database, returns an empty list.
        Parameters:
        actor1 - the name of the donor actor
        actor2 - the name of the final recipient actor
        Returns:
        list of strings detailing the individual handoffs in the shortest paths

      • connectPieces

        public List<List<String>> connectPieces(String actor1,
                                        String actor2)
        Executes the connect command by searching for the shortest path between the two actors specified by the strings actor1 and actor2 for which bacon to be handed off. Instead of returning the shortest path as a list however, returns it as a list of lists of strings containing the donor, the recipient, and the film in which they acted together (in that order). If the actors aren't found in the database, returns an empty list. If there's no connection between the actors, returns a list of one list that has just the two actor names.
        Parameters:
        actor1 - the name of the donor actor
        actor2 - the name of the final recipient actor
        Returns:
        list of lists of strings detailing the shortest path

      • queryTable

        public String queryTable(String name,
                         String getAttr,
                         String parameter,
                         String table)
        Queries the database for an attribute value.
        Parameters:
        name - the value to set the parameter for which to search
        getAttr - the attribute of which to search for its value
        parameter - attribute to which to set as the parameter
        table - the table to query
        Returns:
        the attribute value

      • queryTableList

        public List<String> queryTableList(String name,
                                   String get,
                                   String from)
        Queries the database for a list of films that an actor acts in or a list of actors that act in a film.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the actor or film
        get - "actor" or "film"
        from - "actor" or "film" (who has name)
        Returns:
        the list of names of qualifying films or actors

      • checkFirstLetters

        public static boolean checkFirstLetters(String name1,
                                        String name2)
        Given two strings representing two full names, returns true if the last name of the first person begins with the same letter as the first name of the second person. Otherwise, returns false. Takes into account suffixes composed of Jr. Sr. or nicknames in quotes.
        Parameters:
        name1 - The first full name.
        name2 - The second full name.
        Returns:
        Boolean detailing if the start of the first last name matches the start of the second first name

      • getVertex

        public Vertex<String> getVertex(String id)
        Parameters:
        id - the id whose vertex to get
        Returns:
        the vertex corresponding to the given id

      • getVertNum

        public int getVertNum(String id)
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the vertex whose vertex num to get
        Returns:
        the num of the vertex

      • getConn

        public Connection getConn()
        Returns:
        the open connection

      • getGraph

        public EdgeSetGraph<String> getGraph()
        Returns:
        the graph contained in this bacon object

      • getActors

        public List<String> getActors()
        Gets all the actors from the database as a list of strings. If no database has been loaded yet, returns an empty list.
        Returns:
        all the actors in the datbase as a list
